intro.subheading: Discover the passion and expertise behind Sam's English School, where we are committed to providing exceptional English language education and building a supportive learning environment for students around the world.
intro.founderTitle: Sam Mittal - Founder & Teacher at Sam's English School
intro.founderBio1: My name is Sam Mital, and I am passionate about education and language learning. With over 10 years of teaching experience, I have had the privilege of working in 15 different countries and teaching at many universities. As a former IELTS examiner, I have seen first-hand the transformative power of language education.
intro.founderBio2: I founded Sam's English School to make a positive impact on people's lives through language learning. Our mission is to open up new possibilities for personal and professional growth by mastering English. We believe that learning a new language can open doors to a world of opportunities and enrich lives in meaningful ways.
intro.founderBio3: At Sam's English School, we are committed to making a difference. We invite you to join us our community and start your journey of positive change and growth. Together, we can make a significant impact on your life and career.
intro.founderBio4: Join us and experience the positive transformation that language learning can bring.
intro.missionDescription: At Sam's English School, we believe that every student can become the best version of themselves through a quality and inspiring English learning environment. We do not just teach language, but also develop confidence, critical thinking and communication skills for students of all ages. With a dedicated team of native teachers and a personalized teaching method, Sam's is committed to accompanying students on a solid and inspiring journey to conquer English.
intro.visionDescription1: At Sam's English School, we aim to build a generation of students who are confident, capable and ready to integrate globally through their ability to use English fluently.
intro.visionDescription2: We constantly innovate teaching methods, creating a positive, modern and inspiring learning environment, helping students develop comprehensively in language, thinking and soft skills.
intro.visionDescription3: Our vision is to become a leading English center, where every student is given the opportunity to reach out and shine on their learning and life journey.

1.title: Foreigners volunteering in Vietnam
1.content: A few months after graduating from high school, Mara carried her suitcase alone and flew from Berlin to Ho Chi Minh City to start a year of volunteering. She found a job teaching English for free at a center in Binh Thanh district through the Worldpacker application.

2.title: Digital nomads flock to Vietnam
2.content: At a Mui Ne coffee shop, Sam turns on his laptop to teach English to 4 students. The 33-year-old British man has been to 51 countries, came to Vietnam 4 years ago and rode a motorbike from Ca Mau to Ha Giang.

3.title: Funny and Tragic: Western Tourist Learns to Survive the Blazing Heat of Ho Chi Minh City – Practicing... Napping and Drinking Sugarcane Juice
3.content: Zach (30 years old) is an American who has been living in Ho Chi Minh City for 9 months. He works as an English teacher at language centers and secondary schools. Zach jokingly said that he has been 'fighting' against the extreme heat during the peak of the hot season.

trending.title: Trending News
trending.headline: Foreigners Who Choose Ho Chi Minh City as Their Home
trending.paragraph1: Like Jay, Sam – 34 years old, from the UK – shared that although he has traveled to 65 countries, he still chose to live in Ho Chi Minh City and considers it his home. Sam was deeply impressed by Vietnam during a cross-country motorbike trip with five friends. He recounted a rainy afternoon in Cai Be (Tien Giang), when the group stood in front of a small house with baskets of fruit on a bench at the door—presumably for sale to passersby. Soaked, hungry, and cold, Sam asked to buy some fruit to stave off hunger.
trending.paragraph2: Sam chose to live in Ho Chi Minh City because it’s easy to find an apartment, European food, or Western-style restaurants here. The cost of living is also much lower compared to the UK. For instance, renting a two-bedroom apartment in the UK costs about $3,000/month, while in HCMC, he only pays around 12–15 million VND (roughly $500) for a fully equipped two-bedroom apartment with a swimming pool.
trending.paragraph3: Not knowing Vietnamese, he had to use hand gestures to communicate with the three people in the house. They warmly offered the fruit to the whole group. Sam shared: “When I tried to pay, they refused, signaling not to worry. They just wanted to give, expecting nothing in return, even though they looked very poor. Their kindness and warmth really touched me. That’s also why I came back to Vietnam.”
trending.paragraph4: Sam’s main job now is teaching English, mostly online. With a flexible schedule, he can work from anywhere, which allows him to always be on the move. He and a few friends have traveled through all the provinces and cities in Vietnam, then returned to HCMC like coming back home.
trending.paragraph5: After six years here, there are still things Sam dislikes—for example, many people sing karaoke all night.
